sentence: 1. **Joke:** Why did the condom go flying through the air? ... it got pissedoff.
**Word:** pissed
**Explanation:** In the joke, pissed can mean being angry and also can refer to being drunk (in context).
**Serious Sentences:** (1) He was so pissed off about the situation that he couldn’t focus. (2) After a few drinks, he got a little too pissed to drive home.
2. **Joke:** I tried to catch the fog earlier but I mist.
**Word:** mist
**Explanation:** In the joke, mist can mean a weather condition and can also refer to failing to achieve something (missed).
**Serious Sentences:** (1) The morning mist covered the entire valley. (2) He felt bad that he mist the opportunity for a promotion.
3. **Joke:** What did the office of admissions say to the recently-accepted urology student? ur-ine!
**Word:** ur-ine
**Explanation:** In the joke, urine refers to the liquid waste produced by the body and phonically plays on you’re in as in being accepted.
**Serious Sentences:** (1) The doctor analyzed the urine sample for any signs of infection. (2) Congratulations! You’re in the program starting next semester.
4. **Joke:** Why does it take pirates so long to learn the alphabet? because they could spend years at c.
**Word:** sea
**Explanation:** In the joke, sea refers to the ocean and phonetically plays on C, the letter of the alphabet.
**Serious Sentences:** (1) The sea was calm today, perfect for sailing. (2) The teacher asked us to identify the letter C in our alphabet books.
5. **Joke:** Whats the difference between a cow and 9/11? americans cant milk a cow for 16 years.
**Word:** milk
**Explanation:** In the joke, milk refers to extracting liquid from a cow and also means to take advantage of a situation.
**Serious Sentences:** (1) The farmers milk their cows twice a day. (2) He tends to milk the situation for all it’s worth when he feels cornered.
